newsitem.title: USA: PAXAR Corp makes tender for Monarch notes.
newsitem.headline: PAXAR Corp makes tender for Monarch notes.

text.p: Paxar Corp on Thursday said it has begun a cash tender offer for all 12-1/2 percent senior notes due 2003 of its wholly owned subsidiary Monarch Marking Systems Inc.

The redemption price has been set at the greater of $1,167.50 for each $1,000 of principal or the present value of the notes determined on the basis of 75 basis points over the 6.75 percent U.S. Treasury note due June 30, 1999.
Paxar said the offer will expire at midnight, EST, on Thursday, April 10, unless extended.
The offer represents the second stage of Paxar's purchase of Monarch, the company said. Paxar said it intends to replace the high-yield debt with bank financing.

Paxar increased its stake to 100 percent from 49 percent in Monarch by buying Odyssey Partners LP senior management's interest for $130 million in cash, warrants, options and shares of Paxar common stock, it said.
Funding for the deal came from a new $280 million bank credit agreement with Fleet Bank.
